Mike Pence said this was his first town hall since the Tucson, Ariz., shootings and he always consults with local law enforcement on security at such events. To me the focus is and should remain on public safety. We volunteer for these jobs, but just because someone comes to a town hall meeting, they should never have to be concerned that there's not a reasonable amount of security, he said. He said town hall meetings are "very routine" for him and said he was grateful that everyone came out Monday in the wake of the Tucson shootings. Gene Huey ` surprised

"There is no question in my mind the Vermont Legislature is going to see an assault from the insurance industry," he said. There will be enormous pressure on the governor and Legislature not to go forward. James Haslam , director of the Vermont Workers Center which coordinated the Health Care is a Human Right Campaign, welcomed the political partnership on display Tuesday as more evidence of the increasing momentum for health care reform.

He says Paul Bremer 's decisions inadvertently stoked nationalist resentments and fanned the embers of what would become the Iraqi insurgency . Donald Rumsfeld had favoured going into Iraq quickly and getting out quickly, handing over power to the Iraqis, but Paul Bremer favoured a slower approach. While I believe Mike Pence would have been a viable candidate for the presidential nomination, I also believe he has the qualifications and experience to be an effective governor.... I will be at the top of the list of people encouraging Mike Pence to seek the Republican nomination for Gov. Rick Perry . -- U.S. Sen. Dan Coats , R-Ind.
